subject: Re: unusual behaviour when executing method from test class
msgSnippet: sorry- just realised how common this problem was. should have inspected the faq more closely :) ... following. ... call ...
messageBody:
sorry- just realised how common this problem was.
should have inspected the faq more closely :)

--- In junit@y..., "ajpeustace" <ajpeustace@y...> wrote:
> Hi
> I'm new to JUnit/this list (I can already see what a powerful tool
> JUnit is - thanks guys) and hope someone can help with the
following.
>
> I've incorporated an old test class I'd written into a JUnit class,
> but a method call that executes normally from the old test class
> throws an unusual exception from the JUnit class.
>
> This is before it even gets to the assertTrue clause in the class-
> the method call doesn't execute correctly, yet exactly the same
call
> executes properly from the old test class, and from within my app.
>
> This is the call:
> Document doc = jb.buildDocumentFromFile
> ("C:\\programfiles\\netbeans\\JTestJDOMBuild", true);
>
> here's the JUnit class:
>
>
> package chi.xml;
>
> import junit.framework.*;
> import org.jdom.*;
> import org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder;
>
> public class JTestJDOMBuild extends TestCase {
>
>
> public JTestJDOMBuild(String name) {
> super(name);
> }
> public static void main(String args[]) {
> junit.awtui.TestRunner.run(JTestJDOMBuild.class);
> }
>
>
> public void testBuildDocument(){
> try{
> JDOMBuild jb = new JDOMBuild();
> jb.buildFile
>
("org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver","jdbc:mysql://coultard:3306/marco", "C:\\pr
> ogramfiles\\netbeans\\JTestJDOMBuild");
> Document expected = jb.buildDocument
> ("org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver","jdbc:mysql://coultard:3306/marco");
> Document result = jb.buildDocumentFromFile
> ("C:\\programfiles\\netbeans\\JTestJDOMBuild", true);
>
>
> Element e = expected.getRootElement();
> String eName = e.getName();
> Element r = result.getRootElement();
> String rName = "adsf";//r.getName();
>
>
> Document empty = null;
>
> assertTrue(!expected.equals(empty));
> assertTrue(eName.equals(rName));
> }
> catch(Exception j){
> j.printStackTrace();
> }
>
> }
>
> }
>
> here's the exception (just in case it provides anyone with JUnit
> clues- I know it seems to be throwing a JDOMException, but as I've
> said, this doesn't seem to make sense, as it executes normally in
> every other context):
>
> org.jdom.JDOMException: Error in building:
> org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl
> at org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder.build(SAXBuilder.java:373)
> at org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder.build(SAXBuilder.java:772)
> at chi.xml.JDOMBuild.buildDocumentFromFile
(JDOMBuild.java:368)
> at chi.xml.JTestJDOMBuild.testBuildDocument
> (JTestJDOMBuild.java:34)
> at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:166)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:140)
> at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
> (TestResult.java:124)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:131)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:173)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:168)
> at junit.awtui.TestRunner$10.run(TestRunner.java:403)
> Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException:
> org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl
> at org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder.createParser
(SAXBuilder.java:459)
> at org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder.build(SAXBuilder.java:335)
> at org.jdom.input.SAXBuilder.build(SAXBuilder.java:772)
> at chi.xml.JDOMBuild.buildDocumentFromFile
(JDOMBuild.java:368)
> at chi.xml.JTestJDOMBuild.testBuildDocument
> (JTestJDOMBuild.java:34)
> at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:166)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:140)
> at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
> (TestResult.java:124)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:131)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:173)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:168)
> at junit.awtui.TestRunner$10.run(TestRunner.java:403)
> JDOMBuild successful
>
> Any insights greatly appreciated
>
> Thanks,
> Alan
